detaileddescription.para: Pulse Oximeter service characteristics for discovery
Pulse Oximeter spot check measurement CCC descriptor
Pulse Oximeter continuous measurement CCC descriptor
Record access control point CCC descriptor
List of characteristics to be discovered; order matches handle index enumeration

briefdescription.para: Parse a pulse oximeter spot check measurement.
Parse a pulse oximeter continuous measurement.
Process a message received from the sensor on the record access control point.

Perform service and characteristic discovery for Pulse Oximeter service. Parameter pHdlList must point to an array of length PLXPC_PLXS_HDL_LIST_LEN. If discovery is successful the handles of discovered characteristics and descriptors will be set in pHdlList.

detaileddescription.para: Perform service and characteristic discovery for Pulse Oximeter service. Parameter pHdlList must point to an array of length PLXPC_PLXS_HDL_LIST_LEN. If discovery is successful the handles of discovered characteristics and descriptors will be set in pHdlList.

briefdescription.para: Process a value received in an ATT read response, notification, or indication message. Parameter pHdlList must point to an array of length PLXPC_PLXS_HDL_LIST_LEN. If the attribute handle of the message matches a handle in the handle list the value is processed, otherwise it is ignored.

detaileddescription.para: Process a value received in an ATT read response, notification, or indication message. Parameter pHdlList must point to an array of length PLXPC_PLXS_HDL_LIST_LEN. If the ATT handle of the message matches a handle in the handle list the value is processed, otherwise it is ignored.

simplesect.para: ATT_SUCCESS if handle is found, ATT_ERR_NOT_FOUND otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (dmConnId_t connId, uint16_t handle, uint8_t opcode, uint8_t oper)
memberdef.name: PlxpcPlxsRacpSend

briefdescription.para: Send a command to the pulse oximeter service record access control point.

parameterdescription.para: Command operator or 0 if no operator required.
